turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Ledger Formation.
turn.2: Ledger Formation The Ledger Formation or Ledger Dolomite is a geologic formation in Pennsylvania, United States.
turn.4: The Ledger is described as light-gray, locally mottled, massive, pure, coarsely crystalline dolomite.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: It may be siliceous in the middle part.
turn.8: Named from exposures at Ledger, Pennsylvania, formerly 3 miles northeast of Kinzers, Lancaster County, Pennsylvania.
turn.10: At Valley Forge National Historical Park, the visitor center parking lot is built within an old quarry of the Ledger, and the former quarry walls are exposed.
turn.11: Any other interesting information you can tell me?
